JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä;Stanislav Pavlovschi
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by Mr LOC and PERSON , lawyers practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . At the time of the events giving rise to the present application the applicant was working as a health officer in Batman .

CARDINAL . On DATE he was shot at and seriously injured in an attack by CARDINAL men in his house in Batman . The CARDINAL bullets fired by CARDINAL of the assailants entered the applicant ’s stomach and seriously injured him .

CARDINAL . The applicant was immediately taken to a hospital by his neighbours and their guest , ORG , who was a police officer . The operation to remove the bullets from the applicant ’s body was performed in the intensive care unit of ORG since his injuries were life - threatening . He spent DATE in the hospital .

CARDINAL . On DATE the police officers prepared a sketch - map of the scene of the incident which described the interior of the house and location of the spent cartridges . They also prepared an incident report in which they noted their findings at the scene of the incident as well as a protocol stating that they had recovered CARDINAL cartridges and CARDINAL bullets found at the scene . The police officers took statements from the persons who had taken the applicant to the hospital . The witnesses GPE , GPE and PERSON stated that they had heard gunfire and had gone to the applicant ’s flat and had found him injured . They then took him to the hospital . Another witness , ORG stated that the applicant had described the perpetrators and had told him that they were members of an illegal terrorist organisation , the ORG . The witness GPE stated he had gone to help the applicant following the assault . He had not seen the assailants .

CARDINAL . On DATE police officers took statements from the applicant at the hospital . The applicant described the assailants and course of events leading to his injuries and asked the officers to bring them to justice . He noted that he had no problem with any person .

CARDINAL . On DATE the bullets as well as their outer casing were examined in ORG . The experts concluded that the bullets had been fired from a CARDINAL PERSON pistol ; however they had not matched with bullets fired from any other weapon which had been used in previous criminal incidents . The experts thus decided that the incident should be classified as attack by an unknown perpetrator and that the bullets and cartridges should be kept in the laboratory .

CARDINAL . On DATE the police superintendent ( Başkomiser ) sent an investigation report on the incident to ORG ( Bölge Asayiş Şube Müdürlüğü ) for transmission to ORG . He noted in the report that the applicant had suffered lifethreatening injuries and that the perpetrators of the attack had not yet been found .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Batman Public Prosecutor received the investigation report on the incident . However he did not initiate a criminal investigation into the incident but merely sent a reply to the Batman Security Directorate noting that the investigation documents should be sent after the identification of the perpetrators .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s representative filed a petition with ORG office and requested information about the ongoing investigation into the incident .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG sent letters to the Batman Antiterrorist Branch and ORG attached to ORG ( Cinayet Büro Amirliği ) and requested information on the investigation which had been carried out until that date .
CARDINAL . On DATE a police superintendent sent the investigation documents and a report in which he noted that the perpetrators had not yet been found .

CARDINAL . The Batman public prosecutor received the documents and sent a further letter to ORG ( Batman Emniyet Müdürlüğü ) attached to the Batman Governor ’s office requesting information on the investigation which had been carried out until DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Batman Security Directorate sent a reply noting that there were no documents in their archives concerning the incident in question . They further noted that the incident had been registered in their records as CARDINAL of infliction of bodily harm rather than a terrorist act . The investigation into the incident had been followed by ORG attached to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Batman Security Directorate sent a reply to ORG and noted that the investigations were still pending .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG sent a letter to ORG attached to ORG and requested their office to carry out an investigation into the perpetrators of the attack and to inform him of their findings .
CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG sent a letter to the applicant ’s representative and informed him that the investigation was still pending and that the perpetrators could not be identified .

CARDINAL . On DATE police officers from the ORG - terrorist branch of ORG arrested a person , PERSON , on suspicion of membership of an illegal organisation , the ORG . In his statements to the police , PERSON gave a detailed account of the activities he had carried out in the ORG and stated , among other things , that he had perpetrated the attack on the applicant together with a certain GPE and that he had shot the applicant in his flat in Batman .
CARDINAL . On DATE , police officers took PERSON to the applicant ’s flat in Batman . PERSON told them the details of the attack on the applicant .

CARDINAL . NORP In a letter of DATE ORG at ORG informed the Batman Chief Public Prosecutor that the GPE police had caught a member of the ORG and that this person had admitted having been involved in the attack on the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG sent an investigation report ( fezleke ) to ORG office at ORG noting PERSON as an accused who had perpetrated the attack on the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Batman Public Prosecutor filed a bill of indictment against PERSON charging him under LAW , with attempting to undermine the constitutional order . In the bill of indictment the public prosecutor noted that PERSON had perpetrated the armed assault on the applicant on the instructions of another ORG member PERSON The applicant was named as CARDINAL of the complainants .
CARDINAL . NORP In its assessment report ( tensip zaptı ) dated DATE ORG stated that the applicant should be heard as a complainant .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG heard oral evidence from PERSON When asked about his involvement in the attack on the applicant , PERSON claimed that he did not know him and he had not been involved in the attack .
CARDINAL . In a letter of DATE ORG asked ORG to take statements from the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG heard the applicant who stated that he did not know who had shot him . He asked the court to bring the perpetrators of the attack to justice .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case file concerning the prosecution of PERSON was joined to the main investigation file ( no . CARDINAL ) concerning the ORG .
CARDINAL . As a result of dispute over jurisdiction between ORG and ORG , case file no . CARDINAL was sent to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided that all cases concerning the prosecution of members of the ORG should be joined to the main file no . CARDINAL pending before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case concerning the trial of PERSON was joined to the main file before ORG .
CARDINAL . According to the ORG ’s submissions dated DATE , it appears that the criminal proceedings against PERSON and other ORG members are still pending before ORG .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice are set out in the Yaşa v. GPE judgment of DATE ( Reports of Judgments and Decisions CARDINALVI , § § DATE )
